meanings.definition: To clean with water and usually soap or detergent.
meanings.sent1: I always washup my hands before eating dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to washup her car every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to washup its face with its paws.
meanings.sent4: After playing in the mud, the kids needed to washup thoroughly.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped washup the streets, making them look fresh.

meanings.definition: A cleaning with water and soap or other cleansing liquid.
meanings.sent1: Mom gave the kitchen floor a good washup yesterday.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy a relaxing washup in the bathtub after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The washup of the dishes was a team effort after the big dinner.
meanings.sent4: The washup of the car left it sparkling in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The washup of the windows made the whole house brighter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is washed up or washed ashore.
meanings.sent1: The storm brought a strange washup onto the beach.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman found an interesting washup while walking along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The washup of the old boat was a mystery to the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The washup of shells on the sand delighted the children.
meanings.sent5: The washup of debris after the flood was overwhelming.
